work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

education.institution: Chinese Academic of Science, Institution of Automation
education.area: Deep Reinforcement Learning and robot control
education.studyType: Ph.D degree, supervised by Dongbin Zhao
Upper Second Class Honours Bechalor Degree

experience.name: Dajiang Innovations Technology Co., Ltd (DJI)
experience.position: MCU embedded engineer in R&D Center, Flight Dept.
highlights: Developed drivers for chips using I2C, SPI, and other protocols, including charging chips, Hall joysticks, and IMUs.
Developed an RTOS-based embedded system to meet business requirements.
Design an arbiter that mimics RTOS priority rules to streamline warning prompts for clear logic.

experience.name: Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences
highlights: Developed a RTOS-based program for multi-task handling on a robot.
Implemented Yolov3 for armor detection and tracking on Xavier.
Implemented a Kalman filter for real-time multi-sensor data fusion to achieve accurate robot positioning.
Won 1st prize in RMUA China and 2nd prize globally in the 2021 RoboMaster University AI Challenge.

awards.title: Xuteli Graduates Award, Beijing Institute of Technology

publications.name: Boosting continuous control with consistency policy
Generalizing Consistency Policy to Visual RL with Prioritized Proximal Experience Regularization

interests.name: Travel
keywords: Mountain Climbing. Summitted 6178 Meters Yuzhu Peak/Sob Gangri on 12th Jul 2019

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
